meanings.definition: A signature added to a document already signed by another person to confirm its authenticity.
meanings.sent1: The countersignatures on the contract proved that it was genuine.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer requested two countersignatures on the legal agreement.
meanings.sent3: The countersignatures on the will made sure it wasn't a fake.
meanings.sent4: Her countersignatures were like seals of approval on the paperwork.
meanings.sent5: The importance of countersignatures cannot be underestimated in legal matters.

meanings.definition: To sign a document as a witness to another person's signature.
meanings.sent1: Please countersignatures here to validate the agreement.
meanings.sent2: I had to countersignatures the deed before it was official.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to countersignatures the dog's paw print on the paper.
meanings.sent4: She countersignatures the contract with a flourish of her pen.
meanings.sent5: Countersignatures are necessary to confirm the authenticity of the signature.
